meanings.definition: The act of occupying or taking possession of a place.
meanings.sent1: The occupancy of the house by the new owners was a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent2: The hotel's occupancy rate was high during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The occupancy of the playground by the children brought laughter and fun.
meanings.sent4: The occupancy of the stage by the talented performers captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tents added to the festive occupancy of the campsite.

meanings.definition: The state of being occupied or in use.
meanings.sent1: The occupancy of the seats in the theater indicated a full house.
meanings.sent2: The occupancy of the parking lot showed that the store was busy.
meanings.sent3: The occupancy of the kitchen by the chefs created a bustling atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The occupancy of the classrooms by students filled the school with energy.
meanings.sent5: The occupancy of the beach by sunbathers painted a picture of relaxation.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which a property is occupied.
meanings.sent1: The short-term occupancy of the apartment was perfect for the visiting family.
meanings.sent2: The long-term occupancy of the office space was beneficial for the company.
meanings.sent3: The temporary occupancy of the cabin by the hikers was a welcome break.
meanings.sent4: The continuous occupancy of the shop by customers kept the business thriving.
meanings.sent5: The seasonal occupancy of the resort brought different experiences throughout the year.
